title: 2018 National League play-off Final
text:
The 2018 National League play-off Final , known as the Vanarama National League Promotion Final for sponsorship reasons, was a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> match played at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a> in London on 12 May 2018 to decide the second team to be promoted from the <a href="National%20League%20%28English%20football%29">National League</a> to <a href="EFL%20League%20Two">EFL League Two</a> for the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20EFL%20League%20Two">2018–19 season</a>. The culmination of the 2018 National League play-offs saw <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a> beat <a href="Boreham%20Wood%20F.C.">Boreham Wood</a> to earn promotion alongside the National League champions <a href="Macclesfield%20Town%20F.C.">Macclesfield Town</a>. 
Boreham Wood entered the play-offs having finished fourth in the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20National%20League">2017–18 National League</a> while Tranmere Rovers finished two places above in second. The play-off format was changed for this season with second and third place teams receiving a <a href="Bye%20%28sports%29">bye</a> to the semi-finals while the fourth to seventh place teams played a qualifying round to determine the other two semi-finalists. Boreham Wood beat seventh-placed <a href="AFC%20Fylde">AFC Fylde</a> 2–1 in their qualifying round and third-placed <a href="Sutton%20United%20F.C.">Sutton United</a> 3-2 in the semi-final. Tranmere faced sixth-placed <a href="Ebbsfleet%20United%20F.C.">Ebbsfleet United</a> in their semi-final, after Ebbsfleet beat <a href="Aldershot%20Town%20F.C.">Aldershot Town</a> in the other qualifying round via a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty-shootout</a>, Tranmere won 4–2 to reach the final.
Match.
